title: SWM looking for tall slender ....font
content:
Hi.

new here.

I feel a little like brown shoes with a tux..........but......

there appears to be quite a wealth of information & interesting design concepts wandering around, so here goes......

I’m an architect. looking for a very tall very slender font for a new logo.  
Similar to Blakely light, Newport classic, Bougainville Light, Ingram BT.  
thin, wispy,  
needs to have a cool S.  
The S’s the above fonts all are more like letters - i’m thinking like a soft S turn in the road.....doesn’t round over at the top or bottom. kind of like the S in city blueprint, but more compressed, taller.

It SEEMS like I have seen this font .....somewhere.

I will understand if the general response is pfffffffft.......

but any help appreciated.

bob

 [‹ Letritas: 2 years type party invitation](http://web.archive.org/web/20081022225513/http:/typophile.com/node/43173 "Go to previous forum topic") [Some OpenType sans with arbitrary fractions? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081022225513/http:/typophile.com/node/43319 "Go to next forum topic")
author: robertsmiller

comments.content: See if [http://www.fontdiner.com/main.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20081022225513/http:/www.fontdiner.com/main.html "http://www.fontdiner.com/main.html") has something for you.
Well, Anna has the S you want. I don’t know if you will like the rest of the features ... very deco.

[Mostra](http://web.archive.org/web/20081022225513/http:/ms-studio.com/FontSales/mostra.html) (I’d recommend set 3 for the ’S’ you want).

- Lex
